oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Keepsake album
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Red keepsake album embossed with gold. Soldiers signed her book when they passed through, and some even wrote poems. The item belonged to the William K. Barley family, descendant of Jonathan Bachman and William McClellan families. The book belonged to Nancy McClellan, born 1845, known as "Nan" or "Nannie." She lived in the Kingsport/"Clover Bottom" area, and was 19 at the time in which she obtained autographs and notes from soldiers.
